intro: Daphne stapfii, commonly known as the Stapf daphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its flowers, which appear in late spring, are usually pink or white and are clustered in umbels. Daphne stapfii is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
